summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, providing passwords for discovery materials related to the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell. The document is part of the legal process for sharing evidence in the prosecution.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Signatory of the letter providing passwords for discovery materials in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which discovery materials are being shared.

connections.description: Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is part of the prosecution team handling the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Password Transmission
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office transmits passwords for a drive and CD containing discovery materials pertinent to Ghislaine Maxwell's case to the Metropolitan Detention Center.

locations: U.S. Department of Justice, Southern District of New York, The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The document is a formal correspondence from the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (docket 20 Cr. 330).
It provides specific passwords (WO-6290_20201104 for a drive, and another for a CD) to access discovery materials related to Ghislaine Maxwell.
The letter is addressed to the legal department of the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn, where Maxwell was likely held.
Audrey Strauss was serving as the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York at the time.
The document indicates an ongoing legal process of evidence sharing (discovery) in Maxwell's prosecution in November 2020.
